description:
'''Angela''' "'''Angie'''" '''Martinez''' (born January 9, 1971) is an American radio personality, podcaster, singer, former rapper and actress. Dubbed "The Voice of New York", Martinez is widely known for her 28-year run at New York City station [[WQHT|Hot 97 (WQHT)]]. She left the station in 2014 to join crosstown competitor [[WWPR-FM|Power 105.1 (WWPR)]].

As a rapper, Martinez received praise for her bars when she was featured on the remix for [[Lil' Kim]]'s "[[Not Tonight (song)|Not Tonight]]" (1996). She later released two albums, [[Up Close and Personal (Angie Martinez album)|''Up Close and Personal'']] (2001) and [[Animal House (Angie Martinez album)|''Animal House'']] (2002), before retiring in 2003 to pursue her radio and entrepreneurial careers. As of 2024, she also hosts her own podcast through her [[YouTube]] channel, ''IRL'' (short for ''In Real Life'') in which she interviews various entertainment industry figures, of all ages.
